001package org.biopax.paxtools.impl.level3;
002
003
004import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
005import org.biopax.paxtools.model.level3.*;
006import org.biopax.paxtools.util.BPCollections;
007import org.biopax.paxtools.util.ClassFilterSet;
008
009import java.util.Set;
010
011import static org.biopax.paxtools.util.SetEquivalenceChecker.hasEquivalentIntersection;
012
013public class EvidenceImpl extends XReferrableImpl implements Evidence
014{
015
016        private Set<ExperimentalForm> experimentalForm;
017        private Set<Score> confidence;
018        private Set<EvidenceCodeVocabulary> evidenceCode;
019
020        /**
021         * Constructor.
022         */
023        public EvidenceImpl()
024        {
025                this.confidence = BPCollections.I.createSafeSet();
026                this.evidenceCode = BPCollections.I.createSafeSet();
027                this.experimentalForm = BPCollections.I.createSafeSet();
028        }
029
030        //
031        // BioPAXElement interface implementation
032        //
033        ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
034
035        public Class<? extends Evidence> getModelInterface()
036        {
037                return Evidence.class;
038        }
039
040
041        //
042        // Evidence interface implementation
043        //
044        ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
045
046
047        /**
048         * Confidence in the containing instance.  Usually a statistical measure.
049         *
050         * @return a set of scores representing confidence
051         */
052        public Set<Score> getConfidence()
053        {
054                return confidence;
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * Confidence in the containing instance.  Usually a statistical measure.
059         *
060         * @param confidence a new confidence measure to add
061         */
062        public void addConfidence(Score confidence)
063        {
064                if(confidence != null)
065                        this.confidence.add(confidence);
066        }
067
068        /**
069         * Confidence in the containing instance.  Usually a statistical measure.
070         *
071         * @param confidence a confidence measure to be removed.
072         */
073        public void removeConfidence(Score confidence)
074        {
075                if(confidence != null)
076                        this.confidence.remove(confidence);
077        }
078
079        /**
080         * A pointer to a term in an external controlled vocabulary, such as the GO, PSI-MI or BioCyc
081         * evidence codes, that describes the nature of the support, such as 'traceable author statement'
082         * or 'yeast two-hybrid'.
083         *
084         * @return a set of evidence codes  for this evidence type.
085         */
086        public Set<EvidenceCodeVocabulary> getEvidenceCode()
087        {
088                return evidenceCode;
089        }
090
091        /**
092         * A pointer to a term in an external controlled vocabulary, such as the GO, PSI-MI or BioCyc
093         * evidence codes, that describes the nature of the support, such as 'traceable author statement'
094         * or 'yeast two-hybrid'.
095         *
096         * @param evidenceCode a new evidence code  for this evidence.
097         */
098        public void addEvidenceCode(EvidenceCodeVocabulary evidenceCode)
099        {
100                if(evidenceCode != null)
101                        this.evidenceCode.add(evidenceCode);
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * A pointer to a term in an external controlled vocabulary, such as the GO, PSI-MI or BioCyc
106         * evidence codes, that describes the nature of the support, such as 'traceable author statement'
107         * or 'yeast two-hybrid'.
108         *
109         * @param evidenceCode to be removed
110         */
111        public void removeEvidenceCode(EvidenceCodeVocabulary evidenceCode)
112        {
113                if(evidenceCode != null)
114                        this.evidenceCode.remove(evidenceCode);
115        }
116
117        public Set<ExperimentalForm> getExperimentalForm()
118        {
119                return experimentalForm;
120        }
121
122        public void addExperimentalForm(ExperimentalForm experimentalForm)
123        {
124                if(experimentalForm != null)
125                        this.experimentalForm.add(experimentalForm);
126        }
127
128        public void removeExperimentalForm(ExperimentalForm experimentalForm)
129        {
130                if(experimentalForm != null)
131                        this.experimentalForm.remove(experimentalForm);
132        }
133
134// ------------------------ INTERFACE METHODS ------------------------
135
136        /**
137         * Answers whether two Evidence objects are semantically equivalent.
138         * (Currently, it considers only member UnificationXrefs and EvidenceCodeVocabularies
139         * for comparison...)
140         * 
141         * TODO: review; compare ExperimentalForm and Confidence values; or - simply always return false!
142         */
143        @Override
144        protected boolean semanticallyEquivalent(BioPAXElement element) {
145                if(! (element instanceof Evidence) ) return false;
146                Evidence that = (Evidence) element; // not null (guaranteed by here)
147                boolean hasAllEquivEvidenceCodes = false;
148                
149                if(this.getEvidenceCode().isEmpty()) {
150                        if(that.getEvidenceCode().isEmpty()) {
151                                hasAllEquivEvidenceCodes = true;
152                        }
153                } else {
154                        if(!that.getEvidenceCode().isEmpty()) {
155                                Set<EvidenceCodeVocabulary> shorter;
156                                Set<EvidenceCodeVocabulary> longer;
157                                if (this.getEvidenceCode().size() < that.getEvidenceCode().size())
158                                {
159                                        shorter = this.getEvidenceCode();
160                                        longer  = that.getEvidenceCode();
161                                } else {
162                                        longer = this.getEvidenceCode();
163                                        shorter  = that.getEvidenceCode();
164                                }
165                                
166                                /* each ECV in the 'shorter' set must find its equivalent
167                                 * in the 'longer' set; 
168                                 * otherwise two Evidence objects (this and that) are not equiv.
169                                 */
170                                hasAllEquivEvidenceCodes = true; // initial guess
171                                for(EvidenceCodeVocabulary secv : shorter) {
172                                        boolean foundEquiv = false;
173                                        for(EvidenceCodeVocabulary lecv : longer) {
174                                                if(secv.isEquivalent(lecv)) {
175                                                        foundEquiv = true;
176                                                }
177                                        }
178                                        if(!foundEquiv) {
179                                                hasAllEquivEvidenceCodes = false;
180                                                break;
181                                        }
182                                }
183                        }
184                }
185                
186                //consider publication xrefs!
187                boolean hasCommonPublicationXref = hasEquivalentIntersection(
188                                new ClassFilterSet<Xref, PublicationXref>(getXref(), PublicationXref.class),
189                                new ClassFilterSet<Xref, PublicationXref>(that.getXref(), PublicationXref.class));
190                
191                return super.semanticallyEquivalent(element) && hasAllEquivEvidenceCodes && hasCommonPublicationXref;
192        }
193
194}
